original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /

analyzed: pra m'a na barti ka a'a lam k'a ra /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /

analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan /

original: tshad ma yang dag 'gro la phan bzhed pa //

analyzed: rtog ge ngan 'khrul 'gro ba la brtse bas //

analyzed: tshad ma grub pa tshul bzhin bshad par bya //

original: skabs don rgya cher byed pa'i rab tu gsal bar smra po don dam sdud pa'i blos //
analyzed: skabs don rgya cher byed pa'i rab tu gsal bar smra po don dam sdud pa'i blos //

original: snying po ma yin pa yi tshul bsal ba dag phal cher mthong ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: snying po ma yin pa yi tshul bsal ba dag phal cher mthong ba med pa nyid //
translated: Has mostly seen the way to eliminate what is not the essence.

original: des na 'dir ni mnog med tshul dang bral bas skal ldan blo mi brtan rnams kyi ;
analyzed: des na 'dir ni mnog med tshul dang bral bas skal ldan blo mi brtan rnams kyi ;
translated: Therefore, here, free from the way of mere nothingness, the minds of fortunate ones who are unstable

original: / blo ni mtha' 'das dag par bya phyir yang dag rigs pa'i don du blo bsgrub po //
analyzed: / blo ni mtha' 'das dag par bya phyir yang dag rigs pa'i don du blo bsgrub po //
translated: Are made to transcend the extremes and become pure, in order to establish the mind in perfect reasoning.

original: 'di la bstan bcos kyi dang por bcom ldan 'das rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas tshad ma yang dag pa nyid du bstod pa mngon par brjod pa ni /üîΩbstan bcos kyi don yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di la bstan bcos kyi dang por bcom ldan 'das rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas tshad ma yang dag pa nyid du bstod pa mngon par brjod pa ni / bstan bcos kyi don yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The first chapter of the treatise is a eulogy of the Blessed One as a true authority, because of his perfection in cause and effect.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yang dag par sgrub pa yin no //üîΩde la rgyu ni tha snyad pa'i tshad ma la ltos nas /üîΩbsam pa @2a * //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yang dag par sgrub pa yin no // de la rgyu ni tha snyad pa'i tshad ma la ltos nas / bsam pa @2a * //
translated: For the Blessed One himself is the proof of the truth of the authority.

original: dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: His cause is his perfection in will and in performance, in relation to the authority of the conventional.

original: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid yin la /
translated: His will is his desire to benefit the world.

original: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston pa'i phyir ston pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston pa'i phyir ston pa nyid do //
translated: His performance is his teaching, in order to show the world.

original: 'bras bu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //üîΩrang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o // rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: His effect is his perfection in the good of self and other.

original: don rnam pa gsum bzung bas na bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis te /üîΩlegs pa nyid ni gzugs bzang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum bzung bas na bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis te /üîΩlegs pa nyid ni gzugs bzang ba bzhin no //
translated: His perfection in the good of self is his being a Sugata, because he has taken up the three goals.üîΩHis perfection in the good of others is his being a teacher, because he has the ability to show the path to heaven and to liberation.

original: slar mi ldog pa nyid ni rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: slar mi ldog pa nyid ni rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin no //
translated: And the fact that one does not return is like a person who has recovered from an infectious disease.

original: ma lus pa'i don ni bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i don ni bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin its entirety‚Äù is like a pot that is completely full.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni 'gro ba sgrol ba'i phyir skyob pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni 'gro ba sgrol ba'i phyir skyob pa nyid dam /
translated: The perfection of the welfare of others is the state of being a protector because of delivering migrating beings.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos nyid kyis ni rgyun gyi don to //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos nyid kyis ni rgyun gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcontinuously‚Äù is due to the nature of not passing into complete nirvana.

original: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas tshad mar grub pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas tshad mar grub pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Having paid homage to the Bhagavat who is like that, I will explain the treatise called Valid Knowledge.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin la /
translated: The realization of objects of comprehension depends on valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid yin te /
translated: And the Bhagavat himself is valid knowledge

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because he has the characteristics of valid knowledge.

original: /'dis 'jal bar byed pas na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: /'dis 'jal bar byed pas na tshad ma yin no //
translated: He is valid knowledge because he measures.

original: de la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid spyir ston pa ni /üîΩtshad ma slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa /
analyzed: de la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid spyir ston pa ni / tshad ma slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa /
translated: The general presentation of the characteristics of valid knowledge is:üîΩValid knowledge is a nondeceptive consciousness.

original: tshad ma ni mi slu ba can te /
analyzed: tshad ma ni mi slu ba can te /
translated: Valid knowledge is nondeceptive.

original: de yod na gzhal bya grub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de yod na gzhal bya grub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: If it exists, the object of comprehension is established.

original: slu ba yin na bzlog @2b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slu ba yin na bzlog @2b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is deceptive, then it is refuted.

original: dbang po dang don 'brel pa la sogs pa ni slu bas stong pa'i shes pas nye bar mtshon pa nyid de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don 'brel pa la sogs pa ni slu bas stong pa'i shes pas nye bar mtshon pa nyid de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The connection between the sense faculty and the object and so on are indicated by the cognition that is empty of deception.

original: tshad ma tshol ba thams cad ni mi slu ba'i don du gnyer bas rab tu sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma tshol ba thams cad ni mi slu ba'i don du gnyer bas rab tu sbyar ba yin no //
translated: All investigations of valid cognition are applied for the sake of nondeceptive objects.

original: gal te mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the cognition that establishes the possession of nondeception is not the intrinsic reality of that cognition,

original: de rang gi ngo bos shes na de shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brtag pa bya ba ci yod /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bos shes na de shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brtag pa bya ba ci yod /
translated: then since it is not known by its intrinsic reality, what is there to investigate, since it is known?

original: ci ste rang gi ngo bo rig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi ngo bo rig pa ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not known by its intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid med par 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time valid cognition would not exist.

original: phyogs 'di ni khyed kyis bzod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni khyed kyis bzod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: This position is not acceptable to you.

original: de ni ma yin te shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid tshad ma'am mi slu ba can ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang don byed nus par gnas pa yin /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid tshad ma'am mi slu ba can ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang don byed nus par gnas pa yin /
translated: That is not so, because the intrinsic reality of cognition is not valid cognition or nondeceptive. However, it is able to perform the function of its object.

original: mi slu / shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs pas ni 'di tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi slu / shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs pas ni 'di tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not know that a cognition is a valid cognition merely by knowing its own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na don ni btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na don ni btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What then? The object is cooking, burning, etc.

original: byed pa ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni grub pa'o //
translated: The action is the accomplishment.

original: de gnas pa ni brtan pa'am rnam par gnas pa ni mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnas pa ni brtan pa'am rnam par gnas pa ni mi slu ba yin no //
translated: The stability or firmness of that is nondeceptiveness.

original: don byed pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin gyi //
analyzed: don byed pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin gyi //
translated: That action of the object will occur.

original: de'i dus su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus su ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur at that time.

original: des na de dang 'brel pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam gyis nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dang 'brel pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam gyis nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is related to that, but it is not ascertained merely by knowing its own nature.

original: gal te de dang 'brel pa rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel pa rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If its relation to that is not its own nature,

original: de ci ltar rang gi ngo bor rig pa tsam gyis nges par mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar rang gi ngo bor rig pa tsam gyis nges par mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: how is it that one does not ascertain it merely by knowing its own nature?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gnyis gnas 'brel par rig pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis gnas 'brel par rig pa ni //
translated: because the relation of the two is not known

original: gcig gi ngo bo rig pas min //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo rig pas min //
translated: by knowing the nature of one.

original: gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of the twoüîΩis not known by knowing the nature of one.

original: rig pa yin na 'brel par rig /'o na ji ltar 'jug pa'i dus su de shes she na /
analyzed: rig pa yin na 'brel par rig /'o na ji ltar 'jug pa'i dus su de shes she na /
translated: If it is valid knowledge, then it is related to the object. But how is it known at the time of engagement?

original: 'di ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: gal te don byed pa rtogs pas snga ma tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te don byed pa rtogs pas snga ma tshad ma yin no //
translated: If the prior cognition is valid knowledge because it realizes the object‚Äôs ability to perform a function,

original: don byed pa rtogs pa de yang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: don byed pa rtogs pa de yang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: then that realization of the object‚Äôs ability to perform a function is either valid knowledge or not valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma ma yin pas ni don byed pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir de ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pas ni don byed pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir de ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not valid knowledge, it does not realize the object‚Äôs ability to perform a function. Therefore it is valid knowledge.

original: des na de las kyang ni don byed pa rtogs pa gzhan btsal dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na de las kyang ni don byed pa rtogs pa gzhan btsal dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is necessary to seek another realization of the object‚Äôs ability to perform a function from that prior cognition, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: phyi ma'i don byed yod pa las //
analyzed: phyi ma'i don byed yod pa las //
translated: From the existence of the later object‚Äôs ability to perform a function,

original: gal te snga ma tshad yin na //
analyzed: gal te snga ma tshad yin na //
translated: if the prior cognition is valid knowledge,

original: de tshe don byed nyid yod las //
analyzed: de tshe don byed nyid yod las //
translated: then at that time, since the object‚Äôs ability to perform a function exists,

original: phyi ma ci ltar de ma yin //
analyzed: phyi ma ci ltar de ma yin //
translated: why is the later cognition not valid knowledge?

original: gang la gzhan gyi don byed pa gnas pa nye bar sgrub pa de tshun chad tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gang la gzhan gyi don byed pa gnas pa nye bar sgrub pa de tshun chad tshad ma yin na /
translated: If the prior cognition is valid knowledge up to the point of establishing the existence of the object‚Äôs ability to perform a function,

original: gang la rang nyid las de nyid kyi tshe don byed pa myong ba yod pa de ni shin tu @3a * //
analyzed: gang la rang nyid las de nyid kyi tshe don byed pa myong ba yod pa de ni shin tu @3a * //
translated: That which has the experience of the object‚Äôs functioning at the time of itself is the valid cognition.

original: ches tshad ma nyid de don byed gnas pa ni mi slu ba zhes spyir brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches tshad ma nyid de don byed gnas pa ni mi slu ba zhes spyir brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in general that the object‚Äôs functioning is nondeceptive.

original: gal te bsreg pa dang btso ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa de ni rmi lam dang dung la ser por shes pa la sogs pa la yang yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te bsreg pa dang btso ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa de ni rmi lam dang dung la ser por shes pa la sogs pa la yang yod pa yin la /
translated: If the object‚Äôs functioning, such as burning and cooking, exists in dreams and in the cognition of yellow in a conch shell,

original: rang dang gzhan las don byed pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa la ni /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan las don byed pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa la ni /
translated: then the cognition of the object of sound does not have the object‚Äôs functioning, because it does not function for itself or for another.

original: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the object‚Äôs functioning, such as cooking and burning, absent in the cognition of the object of sound?

original: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa tsam tshad ma yin no zhes rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa tsam tshad ma yin no zhes rigs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is logical to say that mere nondefective cognition is valid cognition.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is illogical.

original: 'di ltar sgra las byung ba yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra las byung ba yang /
translated: Because in this way, that which arises from sound

original: mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin no//
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin no//
translated: is nondeceptive because it teaches what is desired.

original: sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni sgra las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni sgra las byung ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the object of sound arises from sound.

original: yang gi sgras ni gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also the case that the other is not a valid cognition.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: ngo bo rtogs pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: ngo bo rtogs pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: If mere apprehension of the entity

original: shes pa thams cad tshad mar 'gyur //üîΩ'on te gnod med rtogs phyir na //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad tshad mar 'gyur // 'on te gnod med rtogs phyir na //
translated: were a valid cognition,

original: rmi sogs la de cis ma yin //üîΩrtogs pa tsam dang 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: rmi sogs la de cis ma yin // rtogs pa tsam dang 'brel pa ni //
translated: then why is it not so in dreams and so on,üîΩsince they also have that?

original: rmi lam dang gzhan pa'i shes pa dag la yod pas na thams cad la mtshungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam dang gzhan pa'i shes pa dag la yod pas na thams cad la mtshungs so //
translated: Since mere apprehension is present in dreams and other cognitions, it is the same in all cases.

original: de ni skyes bu'i don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu'i don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a means of accomplishing a person‚Äôs goals.

original: 'on te gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa nyid yin na de yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa nyid yin na de yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: But if it is only nondeceptive apprehension, then that is the same in all cases.

original: sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is undermined by waking consciousness,

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te gzhan gyi yul med par //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te gzhan gyi yul med par //
translated: what is this so-called ‚Äúundermining‚Äù?

original: shes pa nyid ni der 'dod na //üîΩrang don la 'jug shes pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni der 'dod na // rang don la 'jug shes pa ni //
translated: If you assert that consciousness itselfüîΩis without another object,üîΩthen how could a consciousness that engages its object

original: ji ltar med pa shes par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa shes par byed //
translated: make one understand the nonexistent?

original: re zhig shes pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gis rmi lam gyi shes pa'am gzhan med par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig shes pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gis rmi lam gyi shes pa'am gzhan med par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that some other cognition destroys the dream cognition or the other.

original: de'i dus na de rang nyid zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus na de rang nyid zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time, it itself has already ceased.

original: mig btsums pa tsam gyis zhig pa'i shes pa la gnod pa nyid rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: mig btsums pa tsam gyis zhig pa'i shes pa la gnod pa nyid rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: And there is no realization of the mere closing of the eyes as a harm to the cognition that has already ceased.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis de'i yul 'phrog pa med par shes pa'i mtshan nyid gnod pa yin na rang gi yul la 'jug pas ni gzhan gyi yul 'phrog par byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis de'i yul 'phrog pa med par shes pa'i mtshan nyid gnod pa yin na rang gi yul la 'jug pas ni gzhan gyi yul 'phrog par byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If the characteristic of harm to a cognition is the taking away of its object by another cognition, then when it engages its own object, it is not able to take away the object of another.

original: rang gi yul gyi rang bzhin sgrub pa ni shes pa rnams kyi chos yin la /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi rang bzhin sgrub pa ni shes pa rnams kyi chos yin la /
translated: The nature of establishing its own object is the nature of cognitions.

original: gzhan gyi yul 'phrog ba ni mi'i bdag po rnams kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul 'phrog ba ni mi'i bdag po rnams kyi chos yin no //
translated: Taking away the object of another is the nature of human lords.

original: 'o na ji ltar gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that they are the things to be harmed and the harm-doers?

original: ji ltar rang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: Just as they are not even to themselves.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnod pa med pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnod pa med pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: For that very reason, that which is not harmed is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir @3b gang la don byed pa med pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir @3b gang la don byed pa med pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which does not perform a function is not a valid cognition.

original: gang la rang ngam gzhan gyis ni //
analyzed: gang la rang ngam gzhan gyis ni //
translated: A cognition that is valid or not

original: don byed 'byung ba shes min te //
analyzed: don byed 'byung ba shes min te //
translated: is not known to arise in regard to an object

original: tshad min de nyid du na ni //
analyzed: tshad min de nyid du na ni //
translated: that is either existent or non-existent.

original: rmi lam rmi lam min khyad med //
analyzed: rmi lam rmi lam min khyad med //
translated: In reality, there is no difference between a dream and a non-dream.

original: rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i dbye ba 'di ni tha snyad tsam yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i dbye ba 'di ni tha snyad tsam yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction between a valid cognition and a non-valid cognition is merely a conventional one, just as the distinction between a dream and a non-dream.

original: 'di ni don byed pa rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don byed pa rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fixed rule that a valid cognition must perform a function.

original: brtan pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not stable.

original: rmi lam gyi don byed pa ni goms pa tsam gyi stobs kyis yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi don byed pa ni goms pa tsam gyi stobs kyis yin te /
translated: The performance of a function in a dream is due to the power of mere habituation.

original: de la tshim pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la tshim pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no satisfaction in that.

original: gnod pa med pa nyid yin na ni thug pa med pa nyid do ;
analyzed: gnod pa med pa nyid yin na ni thug pa med pa nyid do ;
translated: If it is not impaired, there is an infinite regress.

original: dang po gnod pa med pa ni thams cad la yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang po gnod pa med pa ni thams cad la yod pa nyid do //
translated: At the outset, there is no impairment in anything.

original: dus phyis gnod pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: dus phyis gnod pa med pa yin na /
translated: If it is not impaired later,

original: de la yang dus phyis gnod pa med do zhes ga las yin /
analyzed: de la yang dus phyis gnod pa med do zhes ga las yin /
translated: How can it be said that it is not invalidated later?

original: dang po gnod pa med pa ni //
analyzed: dang po gnod pa med pa ni //
translated: The first is not invalidated

original: rnam shes kun la yod pa yin //
analyzed: rnam shes kun la yod pa yin //
translated: because it is present in all consciousnesses.

original: phyi nas gnod pa byed yin na //
analyzed: phyi nas gnod pa byed yin na //
translated: If it is invalidated later,

original: der yang ji ltar dogs ma yin //üîΩdung ser por shes pa la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: der yang ji ltar dogs ma yin // dung ser por shes pa la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: how can it be doubted there?

original: de bzhin du don byed pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du don byed pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of a yellow conch, etc., is not a valid cognition because it does not obtain the functioning thing.

original: dbyibs tsam gyi don byed pa sgrub pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gzhan nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam gyi don byed pa sgrub pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gzhan nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: In establishing the functioning thing as mere shape, another inferential cognition is a valid cognition.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / 'di lta'i snang ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di lta'i snang ba gang yin pa //
translated: the appearance as that

original: de ni dbyibs dang 'bral min te //
analyzed: de ni dbyibs dang 'bral min te //
translated: is not separate from the shape.

original: de ltar gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is seen otherwise,

original: de ltar na de rjes su dpag yin //
analyzed: de ltar na de rjes su dpag yin //
translated: thus it is an inference.

original: gang gis nam yang 'khrul pa ma dmigs pa de la ni ji ltar bsams pa la bslus pa'i phyir slu ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis nam yang 'khrul pa ma dmigs pa de la ni ji ltar bsams pa la bslus pa'i phyir slu ba nyid do //
translated: For one who never observes error, it is deceptive because it deceives as imagined.

original: 'khrul pa rig pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par dpyad nas 'jug go //üîΩgzhan la the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: 'khrul pa rig pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par dpyad nas 'jug go // gzhan la the tshom za ba'am /
translated: The cognition of error is a case of engaging in an investigation.üîΩEven if one is uncertain about something else,

original: bzlog par gyur pa yin yang dbyibs tsam la ni re zhig thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog par gyur pa yin yang dbyibs tsam la ni re zhig thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: or if one is mistaken about something else, one can still attain the mere shape.

original: des na dbyibs la ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: des na dbyibs la ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the cognition is valid with regard to the shape,

original: gzhan la the tshom yin pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i shes pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la the tshom yin pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i shes pa gnyis yin no //
translated: but it is uncertain with regard to the other thing. Thus, this is a case of two cognitions, one valid and one not valid.

original: 'dis ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: This also explains the case of the cognition of a jewel in the light of a jewel.

original: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: ci ste 'di ni gnyis yin no zhes gang gis rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di ni gnyis yin no zhes gang gis rtogs she na /
translated: How do we know that this is a case of two cognitions?

original: 'di yang bshad par bya'o //üîΩsgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ston par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang bshad par bya'o // sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ston par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
translated: This will be explained.üîΩThe cognition of sound is valid because it reveals what is intended.üîΩIt is nondeceptive because it reveals the nature of the object that is intended.

original: mngon par bsams pa'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa nyid mi slu ba yin no //üîΩgzhal bya'i @4a * //
analyzed: mngon par bsams pa'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa nyid mi slu ba yin no //üîΩgzhal bya'i @4a * //
translated: The object of cognition is the object of the cognition.

original: rang bzhin grub pa nyid //
analyzed: rang bzhin grub pa nyid //
translated: The nature of the object is established.

original: de ni byed pa yin par 'dod //üîΩri mo la yang mthong tsam gyis //
analyzed: de ni byed pa yin par 'dod // ri mo la yang mthong tsam gyis //
translated: That is held to be the function.üîΩEven in a painting, the effect is complete

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa yin //
translated: merely by seeing it.

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bo rig pa las gzhan pa'i don byed pa grub pa ni gang du yang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bo rig pa las gzhan pa'i don byed pa grub pa ni gang du yang dmigs pa med do //
translated: Here, the establishment of the function of an object that is different from the awareness of its own nature is not observed anywhere.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la yang rang gi rang bzhin rig pa 'ba' zhig nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la yang rang gi rang bzhin rig pa 'ba' zhig nyid de /
translated: In form and so on, there is only the awareness of its own nature.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa gzhan la tshad ma 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa gzhan la tshad ma 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that has that as its object is not a valid cognition in regard to another.

original: de'i rang bzhin rig pa tsam ni shes pa thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rig pa tsam ni shes pa thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The mere awareness of its nature is the same for all cognitions.

original: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not engage with conventional valid cognition.üîΩTherefore, the elements and their products are objects,

original: de'i phyir 'byung gyur don yul dang // yul gzhan gyis ni spyod yul can //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung gyur don yul dang // yul gzhan gyis ni spyod yul can //
translated: and the other sense objects are their domain.

original: tshad ma lhag par sgro btags pas //
analyzed: tshad ma lhag par sgro btags pas //
translated: By superimposing a superior valid cognition,

original: tha snyad rjes su rtogs par byed //
analyzed: tha snyad rjes su rtogs par byed //
translated: one understands the conventional.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang yul gzhan don du gnyer ba ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i tshol ba dang du len to //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang yul gzhan don du gnyer ba ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i tshol ba dang du len to //
translated: The search for the object of a future sense-experience and the object of another place is the acceptance of the search for valid knowledge and invalid knowledge.

original: ji ltar don dam par reg pa la sogs pa yul gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i nang du mi 'du ba de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par reg pa la sogs pa yul gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i nang du mi 'du ba de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yang yin no //
translated: Just as the sense-experience of form, etc., which is the object of a future sense-experience, is not included in the present sense-experience, so also is the object of another place.

original: lhag par sgro btags pas ni de gcig nyid yin pa ltar yul gzhan yang yin no //
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pas ni de gcig nyid yin pa ltar yul gzhan yang yin no //
translated: By the superimposition of the one, the other is also one.

original: des na de'i sgo nas kyang mi slu ba yin par rjod de /
analyzed: des na de'i sgo nas kyang mi slu ba yin par rjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is non-deceptive in that way.

original: gang du de nyid don byed pa der ni rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang du de nyid don byed pa der ni rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Where it performs the function of that, there is no doubt.

original: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la ni /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la ni /
translated: In that case, the object of a future sense-experience

original: de rgyu yin pa nyid kyis gcig tu sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: de rgyu yin pa nyid kyis gcig tu sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: is superimposed as one by the fact that it is its cause.

original: reg pa la sogs pa gzhan la ni de dang tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir khyad par med do //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa gzhan la ni de dang tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir khyad par med do //
translated: In the case of another sense-experience, there is no difference because it depends on the same collection.

original: gang la don byed pa tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gang la don byed pa tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa /
translated: That which is accepted as having a different function

original: dper na smig rgyu la chur 'dzin pa'i shes pa las smig rgyu'i don byed pa thob pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la chur 'dzin pa'i shes pa las smig rgyu'i don byed pa thob pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: For example, the function of a mirage is obtained from the consciousness that apprehends it as water, but that is not a valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgra las byung ba yang mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgra las byung ba yang mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that even that which arises from words is accepted as a valid cognition because it reveals what is desired.

original: gzhan ri mo la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ri mo la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also like that for others, such as paintings.

original: de ltar yin dang bum pa shes pa na snam bu thob pa dang / nya phyis la dngul du shes pa brgyud mar 'byung yang tshad ma ma yin na /üîΩmngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang bum pa shes pa na snam bu thob pa dang / nya phyis la dngul du shes pa brgyud mar 'byung yang tshad ma ma yin na / mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were like that, then when a pot is cognized, a cloth would be obtained, and when mother-of-pearl is cognized as silver, there would be a succession of valid cognitions, but that is not so.üîΩBecause there is no non-deception regarding what is desired.

original: mngon par 'dod la slu med phyir //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod la slu med phyir //
translated: Because there is no deception regarding what is desired,

original: thams cad tshad ma yin par brjod //üîΩrigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i //
analyzed: thams cad tshad ma yin par brjod // rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i //
translated: all are said to be valid cognitions.üîΩIt is not merely from the arising of a consciousness

original: shes pa skye ba tsam las min //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba tsam las min //
translated: of a similar or dissimilar type.

original: gnod @4b par byed pa'i shes pa yang //
analyzed: gnod @4b par byed pa'i shes pa yang //
translated: Even a consciousness that is contradicted

original: de lta'i rnam par gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: de lta'i rnam par gnas pa nyid //
translated: has such an abiding nature.

original: de nyid du na rigs mi mthun //
analyzed: de nyid du na rigs mi mthun //
translated: But it is not a different type.

original: rnam shes skye ba tsam du zad //üîΩgal te rigs mi mthun pa yi //
analyzed: rnam shes skye ba tsam du zad // gal te rigs mi mthun pa yi //
translated: It is simply the arising of consciousness.üîΩIf you say that the arising of a different type

original: rigs skye gnod byed yin brjod na //
analyzed: rigs skye gnod byed yin brjod na //
translated: Is the harm-doer,

original: bum pa shes la snam bu shes //
analyzed: bum pa shes la snam bu shes //
translated: Then, in the cognition of a pot, the cognition of a cloth

original: ji ltar gnod byed rigs ma yin //üîΩgal te min shes dgag 'jug las //
analyzed: ji ltar gnod byed rigs ma yin // gal te min shes dgag 'jug las //
translated: Would be the harm-doer, but it is not a different type.

original: 'ga' zhig gnod byed yin 'dod na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gnod byed yin 'dod na //
translated: If you say that the harm-doer is

original: min no snyam pa'i shes de nyid //
analyzed: min no snyam pa'i shes de nyid //
translated: The cognition that is the opposite of the non-cognition,

original: tshad ma gang las 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: tshad ma gang las 'ongs pa yin //
translated: Then from what valid cognition does that cognitionüîΩThat thinks ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù arise?

original: dngos med mtshan nyid tshad ma ste //
analyzed: dngos med mtshan nyid tshad ma ste //
translated: The valid cognition that is the characteristic of non-existence

original: de las she na de dpyad bya //
analyzed: de las she na de dpyad bya //
translated: Is that from which it arises.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin rig gam ci //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin rig gam ci //
translated: But is it the cognition of the nature of another?

original: ci de'i med pa rig pa yin //
analyzed: ci de'i med pa rig pa yin //
translated: Or is it the cognition of its non-existence?

original: gal te gzhan dngos rig na ni //
analyzed: gal te gzhan dngos rig na ni //
translated: If it is the cognition of the nature of another,

original: khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Then it follows, absurdly, that it would be without distinction.

original: de dngos med pa rig na ni //
analyzed: de dngos med pa rig na ni //
translated: If it is the cognition of its non-existence,

original: de'i zhes 'brel pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i zhes 'brel pa med par 'gyur //
translated: Then it would be unrelated to that.

original: med pa ni rang gi ngo bos rig pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rang gi ngo bos rig pa yin no //
translated: Non-existence is cognized by its own nature.

original: dngos po med pa rang gi ngo bo ni bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rang gi ngo bo ni bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of non-entity is not realized in relation to a pot, etc.

original: bum pa rtogs pa na ni dngos po med pa de dang 'brel ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa rtogs pa na ni dngos po med pa de dang 'brel ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: When a pot is realized, it is not realized in relation to non-entity,

original: de'i tshe dngos po med pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po med pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it would not be non-entity.

original: lhas byin gson po nyid ni shi ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gson po nyid ni shi ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like Devadatta alive not being dead.

original: ma rtogs pa'i bum pa dang dngos po med pa 'brel bar 'dzin mi nus so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i bum pa dang dngos po med pa 'brel bar 'dzin mi nus so //
translated: One cannot apprehend the non-realized pot and non-entity as related.

original: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bzhin du rtogs te /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bzhin du rtogs te /
translated: But if it is realized like the relation of cause and effect,

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu phyis 'byung ba la de'i de ma thag tu dmigs pa de rim gyis rtogs pa na /
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu phyis 'byung ba la de'i de ma thag tu dmigs pa de rim gyis rtogs pa na /
translated: then when the later arising effect is observed in the presence of the cause, it is realized in sequence.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du dngos po yod na dngos po med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du dngos po yod na dngos po med par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the relation of cause and effect is apprehended. Likewise, when there is an entity, there is non-entity,

original: dngos po med pa yin na dngos po yin pas 'brel pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin na dngos po yin pas 'brel pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and when there is non-entity, there is entity, so the relation is realized.

original: de yang ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: That is also not so, because

original: gtan med pa dang 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: gtan med pa dang 'brel pa ni //
translated: And it is not the case that something that is utterly nonexistent

original: 'ga' yang 'grub pa yod ma yin //üîΩmed de dngos yod na min zhing //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'grub pa yod ma yin // med de dngos yod na min zhing //
translated: can be related to anything.üîΩIt is not nonexistent, nor does it exist,

original: der ni bzlog pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni bzlog pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it both, nor is it described as neither.

original: gzhan yang / rgyu 'bras dag gi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rgyu 'bras dag gi rang bzhin ni //
translated: Moreover, the nature of cause and effect

original: de med par yang rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: de med par yang rtogs pa yin //
translated: is understood even without that.

original: de nyid du na med pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid du na med pa yi //
translated: In reality, a thing that does not exist

original: dngos po med par rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po med par rtogs ma yin //
translated: is not understood as nonexistent.

original: stong pa'i yul gang yin pa de //
analyzed: stong pa'i yul gang yin pa de //
translated: The object of emptiness

original: thams cad du ni mtshungs pa nyid //
analyzed: thams cad du ni mtshungs pa nyid //
translated: is the same in all cases.

original: snga na med sogs dbye ba ni //
analyzed: snga na med sogs dbye ba ni //
translated: The distinctions of prior nonexistence and so on

original: de la shin tu srid ma yin //
analyzed: de la shin tu srid ma yin //
translated: are not at all tenable in that context.

original: ci ltar dngos po'i dbye ba ni //
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po'i dbye ba ni //
translated: Just as the distinctions of things

original: mngon sum gyis ni rtogs byed pa //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rtogs byed pa //
translated: are understood through direct perception,

original: de bzhin sngon med la sogs kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin sngon med la sogs kyi //
translated: in the same way, the distinctions of prior nonexistence and so on

original: dbye ba'ang mngon sum las @5a * //
analyzed: dbye ba'ang mngon sum las @5a * //
translated: are understood through direct perception.

original: rtogs 'gyur // gal te de ni dngos med pa'i //üîΩtshad ma las ni 'dod ce na //üîΩgang gi dngos med tshad ma yi //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur // gal te de ni dngos med pa'i // tshad ma las ni 'dod ce na // gang gi dngos med tshad ma yi //
translated: If you assert that it is understood through a valid cognition of nonexistence,üîΩthen,üîΩsince the nonexistence of that is understood through a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma med las rig na ni //
analyzed: tshad ma med las rig na ni //
translated: if the valid cognition is understood without a valid cognition,

original: ci ltar thams cad med min zhing //
analyzed: ci ltar thams cad med min zhing //
translated: how could it not be the case that everything is nonexistent?

original: ji ltar kun du gnyid log min //üîΩgal te med pa 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: ji ltar kun du gnyid log min // gal te med pa 'dzin pa yi //
translated: How could it be that one is not asleep?üîΩIf you assert that the cognition apprehending nonexistence

original: rig pa dngos med yin 'dod na //üîΩde ni dngos po rig med par //
analyzed: rig pa dngos med yin 'dod na // de ni dngos po rig med par //
translated: Is a nonentity,üîΩHow could that be a characteristic of something

original: 'ga' zhig ji ltar mtshan mar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ji ltar mtshan mar 'gyur //
translated: That is not a cognition of an entity?

original: gal te der tshogs 'di nyid na //
analyzed: gal te der tshogs 'di nyid na //
translated: If this very collection of the aggregates

original: dngos po med pa nges ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nges ma yin //
translated: Is not ascertained as a nonentity,

original: dngos po las ni tha dad pa //
analyzed: dngos po las ni tha dad pa //
translated: A nonentity that is different from an entity

original: dngos med rig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos med rig pa yod ma yin //
translated: Is not cognized.

original: 'di med ces bya'i nges pa ni //
analyzed: 'di med ces bya'i nges pa ni //
translated: If the ascertainment ‚ÄúThis does not exist‚Äù

original: de la tha dad rig yin na //
analyzed: de la tha dad rig yin na //
translated: Is a cognition of that as different,

original: de ni gang las skyes pa yin //
analyzed: de ni gang las skyes pa yin //
translated: From what does it arise?

original: dran med dbang po las ma yin //
analyzed: dran med dbang po las ma yin //
translated: It does not arise from a sense faculty that is without memory.

original: dbang po dran pa dang ldan las //
analyzed: dbang po dran pa dang ldan las //
translated: If it arises from a sense faculty that has memory,

original: dngos shes med par 'byung na ni //
analyzed: dngos shes med par 'byung na ni //
translated: It would arise without the cognition of an entity.

original: dbang po yod pa'i rjes 'brang phyir //

analyzed: don gyi de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //

original: lus pa med pa nyid ni /

original: de la bshad pa ni /

analyzed: byed pa po nyid kyang bya ba'i mthar thug pa yin na ;

original: rtogs pa'i dus na ni de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na ni de yod pa ma yin no //

original: sgras ni sngar ma rtogs pa rtogs par nus pa'ang ma yin te gang gis sngar sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i bya ba dang 'brel pa gzhan rtogs pa de nyid bdag gam gzhan la de lta bu'i dngos por rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //

analyzed: tha snyad pa'i mngon sum la ltos nas ni rtogs so zhes brjod do //

analyzed: thams cad du sngon rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bdag nyid byed pa por rtogs pa yin no //

analyzed: ci ste yang 'di byed pa po nyid du bskul bar bya ba ni ma yin gyi /

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /

analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig la rung ba nyid //

analyzed: yul med par ni de ma yin //

analyzed: yul ni dbang po las 'das na //

analyzed: rung ba nyid ni ji ltar rtogs //

analyzed: des ni byed pa po bzhin du 'dir yang nyes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, just like the agent, the error would apply here as well.

analyzed: dpyod pa'i yul las 'das 'gyur ba'i //

analyzed: ngag gi don du ji ltar 'dod //

analyzed: rnam par dpyad na nges par sbyor ba ni 'ga' yang med do //

analyzed: des na thob phyir rdzas gzhan yin //üîΩdes ni sngar yang rigs pa nyid //
translated: What other shape is

original: gang zhig snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos por rig pa dang / de lta ma yin pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pas tha mi dad par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang zhig snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos por rig pa dang / de lta ma yin pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pas tha mi dad par mi rigs so //
translated: And that which is known as a prior or subsequent entity, and that which is not known as such, are contradictory phenomena, and it is illogical that they are not different.

original: tha dad pa dag ni de lta bu nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag ni de lta bu nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: If you think that it is precisely the difference that is to be proven,

original: tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: because there is no other proof of difference,

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩde nyid du na gal te de //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / de nyid du na gal te de //
translated: that is also not so.üîΩIn that case, if it is different,

original: gzhan na sngon nam phyi ma yi //üîΩmngon sum la ci snang min gnyis //
analyzed: gzhan na sngon nam phyi ma yi // mngon sum la ci snang min gnyis //
translated: then it would be seen in the prior or subsequentüîΩdirect perception of the two,

original: mthong ba gang tshe sring bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba gang tshe sring bar 'gyur //
translated: whatever appears and whatever does not appear.

original: gal te don dam par kha dog dang dbyibs de rdzas las tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: gal te don dam par kha dog dang dbyibs de rdzas las tha dad pa'am /
translated: If in the ultimate truth, color and shape are different from substance,

original: dbyibs kyang kha dog las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang kha dog las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: or shape is different from color,

original: ci ltar sngon dang phyi ma'i mngon sum la mi snang /
analyzed: ci ltar sngon dang phyi ma'i mngon sum la mi snang /
translated: then why are they not seen in the prior or subsequent direct perception of the two?

original: so sor mi snang na de las tha dad pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir der snang ngo zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa chen po'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: so sor mi snang na de las tha dad pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir der snang ngo zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa chen po'i mthu yin no //
translated: If they do not appear individually, then since there is no collection apart from them, to say that they appear as that is the power of great delusion.

original: gnyis tshogs pa yang med pa'i phyir tshogs pa yin par ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis tshogs pa yang med pa'i phyir tshogs pa yin par ga las 'gyur /
translated: And since the collection of the two does not exist, how could there be a collection?

original: rjes su sbyor ba ni mngon sum las ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su sbyor ba ni mngon sum las ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there a connection from direct perception.

original: de med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang med pas gang las tha dad par rtogs /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang med pas gang las tha dad par rtogs /
translated: Since there is no such thing, there is no inference either. So how could there be a conception of difference?

original: de'i phyir thun mong ba zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ba zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is nothing at all that is called ‚Äúcommon,‚Äù

original: thams cad rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir khyad par nyid do //
translated: because everything is restricted to its own nature. It is just a difference.

original: de bas na byed pa zhes bya ba'i bya ba ni mchod sbyin byed pa la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par gyi spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa zhes bya ba'i bya ba ni mchod sbyin byed pa la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par gyi spyi ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the so-called action is not the universal of the particular action such as the performance of a sacrifice.

original: de'i phyir sgom pa ni byed pa po'i bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgom pa ni byed pa po'i bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, meditation is not the nature of the action of the agent,

original: de las tha dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no conception of it as different from that.

original: khams kyi don yang rdzas las tha dad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khams kyi don yang rdzas las tha dad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of element does not exist separately from substance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i rdzas yong su rtogs pa'i tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo @18a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i rdzas yong su rtogs pa'i tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo @18a * //
translated: Because of following and reversing, the prior and subsequent substances are understood. The different own nature does not exist separately from that.

original: nyid las tha dad pa med kyang tha dad pa dang ldan par brtags nas bya ba las tha dad par dang / bya ba yang de las tha dad do zhes 'di ni tha snyad tsam du zad kyi 'di dngos po'i de kho na rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid las tha dad pa med kyang tha dad pa dang ldan par brtags nas bya ba las tha dad par dang / bya ba yang de las tha dad do zhes 'di ni tha snyad tsam du zad kyi 'di dngos po'i de kho na rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, having imagined it to be different, it is said that it is different from action and action is different from that. This is just a convention; it is not the case that this is the reality of things.

original: rang gi bya ba dang khams kyi don yang nges par sbyor ba'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur bar rtogs pa des na ci ltar de la dmigs pa'i shes pa sngon gyi bag chags las skye ba dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba mi brjod /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba dang khams kyi don yang nges par sbyor ba'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur bar rtogs pa des na ci ltar de la dmigs pa'i shes pa sngon gyi bag chags las skye ba dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba mi brjod /
translated: When the meaning of one‚Äôs action and element is definitely applied, it is understood to occur. Therefore, how is it that the consciousness that observes it is not said to be arisen from previous latent states and to be without an observed object?

original: 'on te yang mngon sum ni da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir byung ba dang 'byung ba'i yul can yin na dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te yang mngon sum ni da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir byung ba dang 'byung ba'i yul can yin na dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: But if direct perception has as its object the present, then the object of the past and future is not perceived.

original: sgra ni de'i yul can yin yang der 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni de'i yul can yin yang der 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: And even if sound is its object, it is not so.

original: de skad du yang bskul ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de skad du yang bskul ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if it is said that the past and future are inferred from the present,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mthong ba med pa'i don de ni yod ces nges pa de ci ltar /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa'i don de ni yod ces nges pa de ci ltar /
translated: How can it be ascertained that the object not seen exists?

original: rjes dpag la ni 'brel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rjes dpag la ni 'brel ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the connection,

original: der ni de ltar gnas pa yin //
analyzed: der ni de ltar gnas pa yin //
translated: it is so in inference.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul rtogs pa thams cad ni don dang 'brel pa nyid las mi slu ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul rtogs pa thams cad ni don dang 'brel pa nyid las mi slu ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: All understanding of a hidden object is non-deceptive because of the connection with the object.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the understanding of inference.

original: gang zhig gang dang ma 'brel pa de yod na de yod par ni nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang ma 'brel pa de yod na de yod par ni nges pa ma yin no //
translated: If something is not connected with something, then it is not ascertained that it exists when the other exists.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid ni de'i rang bzhin med pa nyid las te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid ni de'i rang bzhin med pa nyid las te /
translated: The non-perception of the object is due to its non-existence.

original: med pa ni rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: med pa ni rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But it is not the case that what does not exist is apprehended as its own nature.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang lhan cig 'brel bar nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang lhan cig 'brel bar nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the result is ascertained to be related to the cause.

original: rjes su dpag pa las ni rgyu las 'bras bu rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las ni rgyu las 'bras bu rtogs pa yin te /
translated: For, by inference, the result is understood from the cause,

original: de ltar gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in another way.

original: me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa la ni 'bras bu'i rgyu nyid dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa la ni 'bras bu'i rgyu nyid dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: In the case of fire sacrifice, etc., the cause of the result is not perceived,

original: de ma byas na phung bar nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma byas na phung bar nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and if it is not performed, it is not certain that there will be a disaster.üîΩBut if the cause of the result is understood, then one engages in fire sacrifice, etc.,

original: 'on te bdag gi nus pa rtogs pa mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid dang / bdag nyid la rtogs pas 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gi nus pa rtogs pa mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid dang / bdag nyid la rtogs pas 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and if one's own ability is understood, one engages in the performance.

original: gal te de ni mtho ris kyi //
analyzed: gal te de ni mtho ris kyi //
translated: If heaven

original: rgyu yin par ni ma rtogs na//
analyzed: rgyu yin par ni ma rtogs na//
translated: is not understood to be the cause,

original: nges par sbyor ba bskul yang de //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba bskul yang de //
translated: even if one is urged to engage in it,

original: de la ci phyir 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: de la ci phyir 'jug pa yin //
translated: why would one engage in it?

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsgom pa dang / nges par sbyor ba dang / khams kyi don rnams phan tshun 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsgom pa dang / nges par sbyor ba dang / khams kyi don rnams phan tshun 'brel pa'am /
translated: For this very reason, the meanings of meditation, engagement, and the elements are mutually related.

original: 'bras bu dang mngon par 'brel pa bsgrub pa yang ngag gi don yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang mngon par 'brel pa bsgrub pa yang ngag gi don yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the meaning of a sentence is the establishment of a connection with an effect,

original: thams cad 'byung @18b bar 'gyur ba yin pas shes pas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir blo dmigs pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'byung @18b bar 'gyur ba yin pas shes pas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir blo dmigs pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things would be produced, because the cognition would not apprehend, and because the cognition would be without an object.

original: des na snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: des na snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the appearance and the conceptualized are combined into one, and the cognition engages.

original: de nyid kyang gzhan sel ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang gzhan sel ba yin no //
translated: And that is the exclusion of other.

original: rig byed las ni rtog pa sngon du byed pa can su yang mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: rig byed las ni rtog pa sngon du byed pa can su yang mi 'jug ste /
translated: No one engages in the Veda who has not previously conceptualized it.

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive elaboration!üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / 'chad pa po yi byed pa'i yul //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'chad pa po yi byed pa'i yul //
translated: The object of the activity of the expounder

original: lhag par sgro btags pa yi phyir //üîΩdon gang blo la rab gsal ba //üîΩde la sgra ni tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa yi phyir // don gang blo la rab gsal ba // de la sgra ni tshad ma nyid //
translated: is a superimposition.üîΩThe word is a valid cognition

original: don gyi de ni rgyu can min //
analyzed: don gyi de ni rgyu can min //
translated: with regard to that object which is clearly manifest to the mind.üîΩThe superimposition is not an object with a real referent.

original: sgro btags pa ni bden pa'i don gyi yul can du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: sgro btags pa ni bden pa'i don gyi yul can du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: This is the position.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the Tattva-samgraha states:

original: bsgrub pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ste dang po'o /
translated: The first chapter is the commentary on the establishment of meditation and so forth.

original: // / gal te don byed par gnas pa mi slu ba yin na /
analyzed: // / gal te don byed par gnas pa mi slu ba yin na /
translated: If a nondeceptive cognition is one that is in accord with the fact,

original: 'o na ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa las kyang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par shes nas 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'o na ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa las kyang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par shes nas 'jug pa na /
translated: then when one engages in an object after having cognized it through a cognition such as recognition, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing,‚Äù

original: mi slo ba bsten pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi slo ba bsten pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because one relies on a nondeceptive cognition, it is a valid cognition.

original: de la sngon med don shes pa //
analyzed: de la sngon med don shes pa //
translated: A cognition of a previously uncognized object

original: nges par gnod pa dang bral zhing //
analyzed: nges par gnod pa dang bral zhing //
translated: is definitely nondeceptive

original: skyon med rgyu las byung ba ni //
analyzed: skyon med rgyu las byung ba ni //
translated: and arises from a faultless cause;

original: 'jig rten 'dod pa'i tshad ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dod pa'i tshad ma yin //
translated: it is a valid cognition accepted by the world.

original: yan lag can la sogs pa'i yul can yang mi slu bar byed pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag can la sogs pa'i yul can yang mi slu bar byed pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, a cognition that has an object such as an aggregate is a valid cognition because it is nondeceptive.

original: 'on te blta ba'i shes pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di tshang ma ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te blta ba'i shes pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di tshang ma ma yin la /
translated: However, this conceptual cognition is not a valid cognition because it arises from the power of a visual cognition.

original: yan lag can yang yan lag gi shes pa'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can yang yan lag gi shes pa'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The whole also arises from the power of the cognition of the parts.

original: de lta na blta ba'i shes pa de yang mig dang 'brel pa la sogs pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na blta ba'i shes pa de yang mig dang 'brel pa la sogs pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the cognition of seeing also would not be valid knowledge, because it arises from the power of the connection with the eye, etc.

original: de la gal te rgyu gzhan dang gzhan tshol na mig la sogs pa rnams yin par thal lo //
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu gzhan dang gzhan tshol na mig la sogs pa rnams yin par thal lo //
translated: If you seek other causes, it follows that the eye, etc. are the causes.

original: 'on te de ma thag pa yin na rnam par rtog pa nyid ni tshad mar thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ma thag pa yin na rnam par rtog pa nyid ni tshad mar thal lo zhe na /
translated: If it is the immediately preceding condition, then conceptual cognition would be valid knowledge.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
translated: Because it grasps the object of apprehension, the conventionalüîΩis not rejected. The mind that does not desire

original: mi 'dod blo ni tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: mi 'dod blo ni tshad ma nyid //
translated: is itself valid knowledge.üîΩBecause that engagement is primary

original: blang dang dor ba'i dngos po yi //
analyzed: blang dang dor ba'i dngos po yi //
translated: with regard to the entity to be adopted or abandoned,

original: 'jug de gtso yin phyir dang // de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba ni gcig nyid la tshad ma ma yin te //
analyzed: 'jug de gtso yin phyir dang // de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba ni gcig nyid la tshad ma ma yin te //
translated: The cognition that arises thinking ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù is not valid knowledge with regard to unity,

original: sngon med pa'i gcig nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i gcig nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it does not apprehend a previously non-existent unity.

original: des ni mthong ba nyid rtogs @19a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni mthong ba nyid rtogs @19a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it realizes what is seen.

original: gang snga ma dang lhan cig gcig tu bzung ba'i gcig nyid ni rtsod pa'i yul gyi gcig nyid bdag gir byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang snga ma dang lhan cig gcig tu bzung ba'i gcig nyid ni rtsod pa'i yul gyi gcig nyid bdag gir byed pa yin no //
translated: The oneness that is grasped as one with the prior is the oneness that is the object of dispute.

original: da lta ba tsam gcig yin na ni grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: da lta ba tsam gcig yin na ni grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: If it is merely present, then it is the establishment of what has already been established.

original: de yang shes pa snga mas bzung ba la gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang shes pa snga mas bzung ba la gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not different from what is grasped by the prior cognition.

original: shes pa snga mas ni de'i 'jig pa'i gnas skabs nyid snga na med par 'dzin to //
analyzed: shes pa snga mas ni de'i 'jig pa'i gnas skabs nyid snga na med par 'dzin to //
translated: The prior cognition grasps the state of its destruction as prior nonexistence.

original: des na phyis rjes su sbyor bar byed pa ni ci ltar bzung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu nyid mtshams sbyor bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na phyis rjes su sbyor bar byed pa ni ci ltar bzung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu nyid mtshams sbyor bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the subsequent application is the connection of just what is grasped.

original: gzung ba nyid du 'dzin pa na yang de dran pa nyid yin pas gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa gzhan bzhin du tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid du 'dzin pa na yang de dran pa nyid yin pas gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa gzhan bzhin du tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Even when grasping as the grasped, it is just the memory of that. Therefore, because it grasps the grasped, like another memory, it is not a valid cognition.

original: mi slu ba ni don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba ni don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nondeception is because it performs the function of the object.

original: don bya ba ni gcig nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba ni gcig nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The function of the object is not established by oneness.

original: dngos po'i nus pa tsam las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa tsam las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the mere potency of the thing.

original: de'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa 'di ni shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa 'di ni shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thought ‚ÄúThis is that very thing‚Äù is a case of recognition.

original: 'on te snga ma dang lhan cig gcig tu rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma dang lhan cig gcig tu rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if it is thought that the object is cognized as being the same as the previous one,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: mngon sum las sngon rig med na //
analyzed: mngon sum las sngon rig med na //
translated: If there is no prior cognition of the object,

original: de dang gcig la tshad yod min //üîΩma rtogs pa dang gcig nyid du //
analyzed: de dang gcig la tshad yod min // ma rtogs pa dang gcig nyid du //
translated: then it cannot be cognized as the same as the previous one.

original: rtogs zhes bya ba bab col yin //üîΩdes na snga ma snga ma yi //
analyzed: rtogs zhes bya ba bab col yin // des na snga ma snga ma yi //
translated: To say that it is cognized as the same as the one not previously cognized is mere prattle.

original: rtogs las kun rdzob pa gcig nyid //
analyzed: rtogs las kun rdzob pa gcig nyid //
translated: Therefore, the very same conventional object is cognized in dependence on the previous cognition.

original: kun rdzob pa yi rtogs 'di la //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa yi rtogs 'di la //
translated: In this cognition of the conventional object,

original: tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no valid cognition.

original: bum sogs yul can shes pa gang //
analyzed: bum sogs yul can shes pa gang //
translated: Whatever cognition is the subject that perceives a pot,

original: de yang ro sogs dag la yin //üîΩshes de dag gi bzung don las //
analyzed: de yang ro sogs dag la yin // shes de dag gi bzung don las //
translated: it is also the subject that perceives taste and so on.

original: tshogs pa rnam par rtog phyir ro //üîΩtshogs las gzhan pa'i gcig po ni //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnam par rtog phyir ro // tshogs las gzhan pa'i gcig po ni //
translated: Because the conceptual cognition arises from the object that is apprehended by those cognitions.

original: 'gas kyang rtogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'gas kyang rtogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: No one cognizes a single object that is different from the collection.

original: thog med bag chags brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thog med bag chags brten pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of beginningless latent propensities,

original: gzhan ni kun du 'dzin pas nyams //
analyzed: gzhan ni kun du 'dzin pas nyams //
translated: The other is impaired by grasping.

original: gal te snga ma de phyi ma la sogs pa gcig tu rtogs pa med na /
analyzed: gal te snga ma de phyi ma la sogs pa gcig tu rtogs pa med na /
translated: If the former does not cognize the latter, etc.,

original: 'o na ci ltar blo tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar blo tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: how can the mind be a valid cognition?

original: de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation is as follows:

original: blang ba dang dor bar bya ba'i yul la 'jug pa ni tshad ma zhes brjod la /
analyzed: blang ba dang dor bar bya ba'i yul la 'jug pa ni tshad ma zhes brjod la /
translated: That which engages the object to be accepted or rejected is called a valid cognition.

original: 'jug pa de la yang blo nyid gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa de la yang blo nyid gtso bo yin no //
translated: And in that engagement, the mind itself is primary.

original: gal te yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don ma rtogs snyam na de lta na yang de 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don ma rtogs snyam na de lta na yang de 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
translated: Even if it does not cognize the object that will arise, it is still a valid cognition because it engages it.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa mi 'dzin pa yang tshad ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa mi 'dzin pa yang tshad ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though inference does not apprehend, it is a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor bdag gir byed pa ma yin no zhes @19b 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor bdag gir byed pa ma yin no zhes @19b 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained that inference does not take possession of the intrinsic nature of things.

original: mig la sogs pa las ni shes pa med par mi 'jug go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las ni shes pa med par mi 'jug go //
translated: From the eyes, etc., consciousness does not engage without them.

original: rnam par rtog pa med kyang goms pa las 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med kyang goms pa las 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Even without conceptualization, engagement occurs through habituation.

original: des na blang ba dang dor bar bya ba'i yul la sngar gyi blo nyid 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na blang ba dang dor bar bya ba'i yul la sngar gyi blo nyid 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since it causes the former cognition to engage the object to be adopted or to be rejected, it is a valid cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a conceptualization, etc.

original: goms pa med pa gang yin pa der ni ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa des na ha cang thal ba ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na re zhig 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams kyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid kyis tshad mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: goms pa med pa gang yin pa der ni ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa des na ha cang thal ba ma yin no // de ltar na re zhig 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams kyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid kyis tshad mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: In the case of one who is not habituated, it is just an inference characterized by recognition, etc. Therefore, there is no absurd consequence.üîΩThus, valid cognition is explained as the cause of conventional usage for those who seek the result.

original: da ni rtogs pa'i 'bras bu'i yul rnam par 'byed pa'i rgyu yin par ston to //
analyzed: da ni rtogs pa'i 'bras bu'i yul rnam par 'byed pa'i rgyu yin par ston to //
translated: Now, it is taught that it is the cause of the analysis of the object that is the result of understanding.

original: gzhan yang blo nyid tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo nyid tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, cognition itself is valid cognition, not anything else.

original: 'di ltar / yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar / yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu /
translated: Thus, the result of valid cognition is the differentiation of the object,

original: blo yi rtogs pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: blo yi rtogs pa tha dad phyir //
translated: because the understanding of cognition is differentiated.

original: 'jug par byed pas ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs par byed pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pas ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs par byed pa'i phyir te //
translated: It is not a means of valid knowledge because it engages, but rather because it causes understanding.

original: rtogs par 'gyur na 'jug gam mi 'jug kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur na 'jug gam mi 'jug kyang rung ngo //
translated: For, even if one does not engage after understanding, still there is understanding.

original: de ltar na yang don gyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang don gyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: And in that case, it is a means of valid knowledge because it establishes the nature of the reality of things.

original: rnam pa gzhag pa'i don la gal te mi 'jug na 'di tshad ma'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //üîΩtshad ma ni thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
